Dating: PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD; ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Statuette of Harpocrates
Description: Representation of the god Harpocrates standing, with the index finger of his right hand at the mouth and with the horn of plenty in his left hand. He is wearing the double crown and the side lock, symbol of childhood. In the Roman Period he was venerated as a god of vegetation and prosperity.
